page.title: 12Chew Valley Lake - Nature
page.content: Chew Valley Lake is now the 2nd best Lake in England for birdwatching, app. {250 species of birds}have been sited. While the birds invariably steal the show, a{colourful array of flowers}in the unimproved meadows and verges along the West side provide further interest for the naturalist. The small pond at Herriot's Bridge is now a reserve intended to provide suitable nest sites. In 1982{Bristol Water {Works}& the{Avon Wildlife Trust}began funding a scheme which has resulted in the formation of small islands within the pool. Ditches have been cleared through the reed-bed providing an{edge effect, willow trees have been planted and some of the islands have been covered in gravel. Whilst it is likely to be another 2 yrs before their full potential as nesting sites is reached, hopefully halting decline in breeding.
